name: Holiday Inn Perrysburg - French Quarter

reviews.title: Bad front desk service, bad management, bad food in restaurant with one great waiter to save the experience
reviews.text: Bad, rude, disgruntled and seem to be bothering them.....the front desk staff was annoyed when i arrived and it was very aware to me that i was a bother to have to interupt their oh so important conversations!! blah blah blah!!! it is called customer service....but i could have checked myself in by the time they decided to acknowledge my appearance.

Horrible food in restaurant .........beyond horrible..........only good thing was salad bar which also needs more work..did have a great waiter Greg who helped to save the nite and we thoroughly loved his service.....thank you Greg you should be running the entire property in our eyes!!!
reviews.title: Between 3 and 4 Stars

reviews.text: I believe this hotel should be rated somewhere between very good (4 stars) and average (3 stars).
reviews.title: Not even close to worth the money!

reviews.text: The very good parts included: the nice staff (especially the woman who was a the front desk very early in the morning); the French Quarter reminiscent decor in the lobby, atriums, and pool areas; the cleanliness; and the activities available (games, pools, etc.). The average part of the rating primarily relates to the rooms. We were able to see rooms on the second floor and on the first floor, in the 1300 and 1400 section, and overall they were clean with some expected wear and tear (i.e., carpets, furniture) but some were quite small and did not have a few items most average hotels currently include: a small microwave or refrigerator. Note, there are a lot of rooms in this hotel so perhaps the others are more modern, spacious, and include these items.
reviews.title: Great Place for Kids

reviews.text: Two things to mention: one, the room we were initially given on the 1st floor / 1300 section - off of the French Quarter Holidome - was non-smoking but someone had recently smoked in it (unfortunate and not the hotel's fault - they gladly switched us to another). Two, that same section includes a large indoor pool, the 'family pool', and that whole area smelled extremely strong of chlorine, even in the room. This is nothing I'd ever mention in a review as pools require chlorine, but this was exceptionally strong and did not seem normal (our travelling partner who we met there has been to over 31 countries said he never smelled a hotel pool that was that strong, which confirmed our thoughts). We both agreed that there was no way we could ever tolerate a room off of that area if that level of odor is the norm and thought it would be worth mentioning for anyone who may have allergies / be sensitive to strong chemical odors. And again, perhaps that was a one time thing, but there is no way it was normal. We ended up in a room on the 1st floor in another section and thankfully did not smell the pool.
reviews.title: HUGE pools and recreation area

reviews.text: Been stopping here for years. Rooms are just average to small but overall facility is very nice. Two separate indoor/outdoor (swim under glass) pools- one reserved only for adults. Large indoor hot tub and another small outdoor pool gives plenty of options. Family indoor/outdoor pool tended to be VERY noisy with water basketball hoops and flying balls. Kids had a ball but hard to sit poolside and "read a book" there. Attendants were vigilant. Ping pong tables, pool tables, and a somewhat run down game room added to the excitement in the New Oleans looking holidome. Separate holidome area near adult pool was more conducive to families playing cards or board games. If travelling with a group, this place is ideal to spread out and socialize.
reviews.title: Holidome was definitely exciting for the tweens in our group

reviews.text: We used to live in the greater Toledo area, and returned to Perrysburg for a graduation ceremony. We had about 15 family members staying in the hotel, and they obliged us by putting us all in the same hallway. The front desk staff were always very helpful, even at 1am when our room key cards suddenly stopped working (apparently they're very sensitive to cell phones, credit cards, and car keys, so keep them in a separate pocket!). My room was very spacious, with a King bed and a sleeper sofa. Our bathroom was a little cramped, though. This hotel features a "Holidome", which is something you pretty much have to experience to fully understand. It's basically a big room with an indoor/outdoor pool (with 4-sided basketball goal in the middle), a large hot tub, and a gaming area with pool and ping-pong tables. It's a GREAT place for kids, and there's plenty of room around the pool for adults to sit and supervise without having to get in the pool. There are 2 other pools here, too - a fully outdoor one, and an adults-only indoor/outdoor in the lobby area. The lobby area itself is spacious, and a great place to meet people or just to gather and socialize. On Sundays, they do a brunch buffet in the lobby area, and it's delicious, even if it is a bit pricey ($14.99 + drink when there's a Panera across the street for much less). The hotel is also centrally located to many stores on Route 20 - Wal-Mart, Target, Best Buy, Kohl's, Office Max, and several grocery stores come to mind off the top of my head. Also, there are several options for dining in this area, though you might want to go down to the Levis Commons area or up to Toledo for more 'fine' dining options. J Patrick's, the restaurant in the hotel, was very accommodating to us when we requested to have a party for a large group, and we all enjoyed our food there. Overall, though, this was the perfect place for our family to gather and celebrate.
reviews.title: Great family-friendly hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is just a really great place to stay and attend seminars. The lunches are always soooo good. The most comfortable beds and pillows. Everyone is very friendly.
reviews.title: Seminar here every year-just a great place

reviews.text: Hi all,
reviews.title: Great place for kids, not for food, or great service

reviews.text: Stayed four days at the Holiday Inn -French Quarter, in Perrysburg Ohio for the USJF/USJA Judo junior Nationals. The hotel in a Holidome. It had two indoor pools and one outdoor pool. The two indoor pools also went partially outside, you swam under a wall to get out. One pool was dedicated to adults, the other to children. The childrens pool was good sized with a fountain/basketball game in the center of the pool. The kids area also had a courtyard with tables for dining, and two ping pong tables. Both pool areas were very nice and the staff worked hard at keeping them clean.
reviews.title: CHRIS CHRIS CHRIS

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks while working in Toledo. The hotel is amazing. The rooms were large and very clean and the service was excellent. This hotel has an astrodome inside. The bar in the middle of the astrodome is cozy and has $1.00 beers on certain nights. There is a chinese carryout restaurant right across the street that uses no MSG and has the best food I have ever had. The servings are large and the price can't be beat. I am still thinking about their food to this day! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in that area.
reviews.title: This hotel is beautiful!
Asked for "clean and quiet" and got it
reviews.text: So we chose this hotel only because we had a great points deal and needed an overnight stop en route to Michigan. When I asked only for a "clean and quiet" room at the desk, the clerk upgraded us to the concierge level. We had a pass key to the floor. A conciege on duty who provided refreshments for the evening and breakfast in the morning in a reserved lounge complete with billiard table . The room was clean, nicely appointed and quiet enough. Flat panel. King. Overstuffed chair. Good mattress and linens. Small bath. Good stay for overnighters. Beyond the concierge floor, I did note several ball teams, families with children, special event attendees (wedding) and vehicle transport drivers in an "interesting" faux Mardi Gras atmosphere in the atrium/bar/pool area. While this was fine this time, if I were to overnight in Perrysburg again (and it was my nickel) I would choose the more sedate Candlewood (where I have stayed before) or HI Express. Different strokes for different folks...

Stayed at the French Quarter over Easter weekend for a family gathering. We had 14 people in 5 rooms for 3 nights. With ranges in age from 2 to 68 everyone had a great time! Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, everything in working order. All staff that I interacted with were extremely helpful and pleasant. The facilities have been updated since our last stay and the new large hot tub in the family pool area was great! There was always lots of activity in the recreation area and it made it a really fun place to hang out. Kids could play ping pong, billiards, foosball, etc, while the adults played cards or just visited and drank. They couldn't seem to keep the pool area stocked with towels, maybe because it was so busy this particular weekend, but more than once we got done swimming with little ones only to find no towels. Once we asked they eventually brought more, but 3 days of this got old. Our group planned to eat at the hotels resaurant for the seafood buffet but when we found out it was $25 per person we decided that was too much. Luckily there were lots of other places within walking distance. Also it was a short drive (under 20 minutes) to the Toledo Zoo.
reviews.title: Great gathering place for the whole family!

reviews.text: This French Quarter was such a great time for our family. The holidome area has a heated pool and oversized whirlpool that were not even being used. My 3 and 5 year old loved having the pool all to themselves. The pool water was warm enough that I was even able to join them in the water without misery. I am quite a wimp when it comes to cold water. The kids thought the pool was awesome because you could swim underneath a flap and go outside. It was snowing outside and the pool water outside was still warm. The hot tub was just amazing. I could have spent hours sitting in there if the kids hadn't wanted to go get some ice cream from the vending machine.
reviews.title: Kids had a Blast!!!!!!!!!! Mom rested in the Hot Tub!!!!

reviews.text: As for the rooms, they were clean and seemed to be newly remodeled. For me, the most important part was the clean and new bathrooms. The hotel allows you to choose which type of pillow you desire so that was helpful. I can't sleep on a pillow that is too firm. I must say I slep like a baby. Had a wakeup call in the morning and they apparently call you 3 times every few minutes just to be sure you are awake. I appreciate that as I sometimes have a tendency to fall back asleep. I did not eat at the restaurant but did order roomservice once while there. It came very quickly and was quite delicious. We ordered pizza from the neighboring restaurant and had it delivered to our room. This was such a hit for the girls. We sat out on our tables that overlooked the holidome and had our own little pizza party.
reviews.title: Nice Getaway in Winter

reviews.text: Our service club recently hosted their district convention at the Perrysburg French Quarter and overall it was a positive experience. Staff went out of the way to assist us with our needs.
reviews.title: Pretty nice place for small conventions

reviews.text: Rooms were nice, what little time we spent there. The internet was fast and accessible throughout the facility. The only negative we found is having convention meals in the atrium area. With the high ceilings, and other guests in the area, it was difficult to hear any speakers during the meeting.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel, horrible stay!
Fun for the whole family!
reviews.text: Where do I even begin.We have 2 small children and it is February and were not willing to have to walk them outside during winter in there bathing suits to go swimming at the indoor pool. I asked the girl 2 different times to make sure the room she was giving us had an inside entrance. We get to our room - yup - outside only entrance. They were nice and got us a room inside. Boy, do I regret that one today. First of all, it being a holidome you'd think it was family friendly. There were drunk people every where. Drinking in the pool, the hot tub, and outside our room. Which, whatever, that was fine, until we were trying to go to bed. The walls are paper thin here. You could here the entire conversation the room next to us was having. There was 20 people outside our room playing drinking games. Finally, I had to call and complain at midnight because I have a one year old who still wasn't sleeping. None of the change machines worked. The bed, hard as a rock. 2 am there were still drunk people roaming the halls yelling crap. I get home, there was an extra $25 on my bill that I didn't realize so I called and they explained it to me - so I decided to tell the girl about my stay in as nice of a way as possible - totally rude and she could not have cared less. So if you are looking to have a party - stay here! If you are looking for a kid friendly weekend - go elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an unexpectedly wonderful experience! There is really something for everyone at this hotel. It's practically a mini-resort, New Orleans design was very unique. There's plenty for kids and adults alike to do. The Sunday Brunch is amazing, and for guests of the hotel, kids eat free! We'll be back soon!!!
reviews.title: Very Disappointed.

reviews.text: I went to The French Quarter with my significant other on Febuary 5th, 2010. We went for his birthday, so I got us the King suite with jacuzzi tub. We decided upon arrival that we wanted to jump right in to the bath before getting ready for dinner. My boyfriend ran the bath and turns the jets on. When he did this large amounts of candle wax and pubic hairs came out of the jets. We were so disgusted, we called the front desk and they moved us from that room to another on the same floor. When we got into that room again we went to run a bath, when we went to look at it there was blood and some type of yellow residue on the tub. We cleaned it off on a white wash cloth and took it to the front desk. At that point the gentleman working was very disgusted as well, and again then changed our room from the third floor to the second floor, taking some money off our bill. We asked to have the tub cleaned before going into that room. When we got in their was a man cleaning the tub and asked us why our other room wasn't good enough. He was the same man that brought us a key the first time we moved rooms. We told him what happened and he promised this room would be clean. The tub was cleaned this time, so we relaxed in the bath, got ready and went to dinner. At dinner we we drank a few drinks, having fun we wanted to go back up to our room and go to bed. When my boyfriend removed the sham at the end of the bed their was what looked like poop streaks on the bed. I didn't know what to do at this point. We had already been drinking and couldn't just leave (although at that point I packed all of my things telling him it's time to go). Neither of us were sober, and the roads were getting bad. So we pulled all the blankets off and layed down. I felt very uncomfortable and unsanitary in the room. I told the front desk in the morening about it and they gave us breakfast, which we didn't even want. I had heard that this hotel was awesome, but from our experience we've found it not be so pleasurable. We will never be returning, and very disappointed in what we saw and the customer service.
reviews.title: Never Again.

aka: Holiday Inn Perrysburg - French Quarter Hotel Perrysburg
description: You will be charmed by the Holiday Inn Perrysburg-French Quarter, the New Orleans-style hotel complete with kid friendly Holidome and separate conference center. Conveniently located in Perrysburg, OH, you are within minutes of downtown Toledo, Bowling Green and Maumee. Directly off of I-75 and within 1 mile of the Ohio Turnpike, you will spend less time in traffic and more time doing what you came to Toledo/Perrysburg to do. Get away with your family to our newly renovated New Orleans Styled Holidome. Features include basketball hoop/shooting water fountain in our indoor/outdoor pool, oversized hot tub, sauna, ping pong table, pool table and foosball table, Game room and snack bar. We also feature a seasonal outdoor pool as well as an adults-only pool located in the atrium (may be closed for special functions). We are located within minutes to Levis Commons Shopping Center and Westfield Mall. Catch a Mud Hens game at Fifth Third Field or take the kids to visit the bears at the Toledo Zoo, both within 10 minutes of the hotel. We have what you need to be productive. In addition to free Wi-Fi access in all guest rooms, we have a separate conference center for you to hold your. Our experienced sales and banquet staff are here to ensure a seamless meeting. For that extra sense of quiet, we offer our adult-only Concierge Floors, complete with a Continental breakfast each morning as well as evening drinks (limit 2) and hors d'oeuvre.
